channel.title: Well New computer; Whats a good one?
channel.description: Whats a good computer; My dads getting a new one due to this one having more viruses than a hoe on it -.- But anyway my dad said he'd get just about any; including a mac..but I heard there hard to use.. So can someone help?

No i do know what i was talking about… and if u think thats its bad to build your own computer (unless u dont know what ur doing) than your wrong…

  1. you can insure you get what you pay for
  2. It can be cheaper than going and spending $2000 on a computer
  3. The quality most people who build there own computers care about longevity and quality of their systems than big companies do…Duh =P
    4)Also because you can learn about computers

And i had to go…

item.title: Well New computer; Whats a good one?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Silver Lining:

Difficult != impossible. Your suggestion that something without OSX cannot be great is just stupid, by the way.

Yes, thank you for that clarification; I choose my words carefully. And it wasn’t much of a suggestion, but rather a precept.

item.title: Well New computer; Whats a good one?
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:104, topic:131952”][quote author=Cunit link=topic=182768.msg1671795#msg1671795 date=1187033677]
the best computers i dont care who thinks otherwise is the ones you MAKE YOURSELF! you can combine all diff parts from other computers and i did it and i belive my computer runs faster than anyone i know… buy a book like “Building computers for dummies” and go try it out may want some help if you have a short attention span
[/quote]

Ok, what processor, how much and what kind of ram, what kind of mobo, gfx card, case?

Anyway, if you build your computer, it would be hard to get OSX on there. Therefore it is not the best.[/quote]Difficult != impossible. Your suggestion that something without OSX cannot be great is just stupid, by the way.

Read full topic
item.source: Well New computer; Whats a good one?

item.title: Well New computer; Whats a good one?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I have to agree with exe, He’s lying. As for the quality of a Mac compared to a PC, it’s more about what you want in a computer, if you want something stable, and very sleek, you should get a mac, it’s got room to upgrade if it still doesn’t meet your needs. If you’re a beginner, you should go with a prebuilt PC, like an HP or Compaq.

If you’re a PC enthusiast, it’s pretty obvious you should either buy a top of the line prebuilt PC like Alienware, and customize it, or build one from the ground up. It shouldn’t matter what OS it is either, you can always put Windows on a Mac (and I don’t know if you can boot OSX onto a regular PC, maybe do a Virtual Machine with VMware, Qemu, or something).

Anyways, I think we’ve really argued our point to the extent that the person that asked the question to begin with should judge which he should get. I mean, not my place to decide, but I don’t think there really is anything else to be said.

Read full topic
item.source: Well New computer; Whats a good one?

item.source: Well New computer; Whats a good one?

item.title: Well New computer; Whats a good one?
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

This reminds me of a saying I heard once. Macs, you either love them or hate them. I personally am a PC guy and build my own computers because I can’t stand prebuilts. Even though I don’t like Macs they are nice computers. In short, I’d go with a PC and a linux distro myself.

Read full topic
item.source: Well New computer; Whats a good one?

item.title: Well New computer; Whats a good one?
item.dc:creator: @Not_X_A_Alex Not X A Alex
item.description:
@Not_X_A_Alex wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:98, topic:131952”][quote author=Not X A Alex link=topic=182768.msg1669957#msg1669957 date=1186968255]
Install for linux…were do i get.
[/quote]

http://kubuntu.com/download.php

Click wherever is closest to you (preferably under Dapper Drake instead of Feisty Fawn). Then choose:
“kubuntu-x.xx-desktop-amd64.iso” if you have an AMD 64-bit processor (not likely).
“kubuntu-x.xx-desktop-i386.iso” if you have an Intel processor (most likely).
“kubuntu-x.xx-desktop-i386.iso.torrent” if you know how to use bittorrent and have an Intel processor.

After burning it to a cd, you can simply restart the pc with the cd in the drive, and hope that it boots to CD. If it does, then you can play around with it, as it is a live cd, which lets you experience the Linux environment without installing.[/quote]
I can’t thank you enough for all this help but thanks!

Read full topic

item.source: Well New computer; Whats a good one?

item.title: Well New computer; Whats a good one?
item.dc:creator: @MybJames MybJames
item.description:
@MybJames wrote:

ThAt0n36Uy:

That is bullshit MybJames, you can purchase a mac pro, with 16gb of ram, and 4 tb of hd, that is a huge amount, not including the fact that the actual tower is about the size of HP’s mini PC. Besides you can use bootcamp to boot Linux and Windows. It’s like the ultimate computer station.

FYI i never said the quality of mac computers are shit, i just said for the price, it aint worth it.

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:95, topic:131952”][quote author=MybJames link=topic=182768.msg1669078#msg1669078 date=1186926704]
Because PC’s have better hardware for alot cheaper.
The only reason anyone wants a mac is so they can have the OS
[/quote]

Again:
http://spreadsheets.google.com/pub?key=pakryTiDNuzb15uHeyj_jMQ

Same hardware, only cheaper by roughly 18%. If you build a Dell, Gateway, HP, etc., it will come out to way more than what an iMac sells for. And don’t forget Apple shoved all those parts into something barely larger than your LCD monitor.[/quote]
I for one never said i wanted portability.

Read full topic
item.source: Well New computer; Whats a good one?

item.title: Well New computer; Whats a good one?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Not X A Alex:

Install for linux…were do i get.

http://kubuntu.com/download.php

Click wherever is closest to you (preferably under Dapper Drake instead of Feisty Fawn). Then choose:
“kubuntu-x.xx-desktop-amd64.iso” if you have an AMD 64-bit processor (not likely).
“kubuntu-x.xx-desktop-i386.iso” if you have an Intel processor (most likely).
“kubuntu-x.xx-desktop-i386.iso.torrent” if you know how to use bittorrent and have an Intel processor.

After burning it to a cd, you can simply restart the pc with the cd in the drive, and hope that it boots to CD. If it does, then you can play around with it, as it is a live cd, which lets you experience the Linux environment without installing.

Read full topic
